project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' with corresponding icons when the text is clicked.
architecture_overview: The project follows the Cubit pattern for state management, ensuring a clean separation of concerns between UI and business logic. All state changes are managed by Cubits, and the UI is updated accordingly.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant HomeScreen
participant TextCubit
User -> HomeScreen: Clicks Text
HomeScreen -> TextCubit: toggleText()
TextCubit -> HomeScreen: Update State
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The TextCubit manages the state of the text and icon. When the user clicks the text, the toggleText method of TextCubit is called, which toggles the text and icon. The state is then updated and the UI is rebuilt to reflect the changes.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) which is displayed when the app starts. The HomeScreen contains a TextToggleWidget which displays the text and icon, and toggles them when clicked.
